posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
I see a strong preference for DwDs in the OP's request and possibly a misconception linking DwD with good AC per se (they get +4 dodge AC in defensive stance only), while DwD is evidently about Damage Reduction. And while DwD has peculiar defensive powers they are not hindering its offensive capabilities compared to other straight melee classes, but evidently WM which is evidently centered about offense. What I mean is that a FTR/DwD/Rogue is not any less offensive than a FTR/CoT/Rogue, for example.

I also find it's not really always appropriate to suggest cleric as the solution to "all" problems. Sometimes one just does not want to play a cleric. IMO, we shouldn't necessarily go for those fews uber builds; there's more about character building than doing and redoing the same 10-20 builds, no matter how good they may be. I find enjoyment in playing also less powerful builds, tweaked and optimized to achieve a specific role and purpouse.

Anyhow, I apologize if I came across harsher than I meant. My dear avado, dude, sometimes just try not to suggest clerics.. it might be a refreshing experience

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:Good one again, Hip. however, you could go Pal 8 (that's when you get lvl 2 spells) CoT 8 DwD 14 for more DR at the cost of saves. You lose 1 to all saves, but the CoT bonus feat is recovered by DWD 14, and you get another DS use and 3/- DR.
TBH, that's the split I had set up before reassessing my priorities a bit.

Without Extend Spell I wanted an hour for my most-used pally buffs so the extra 2 pally levels helps... lots. The Armor Skin is a wash if I had no reason for CoT 10... but I did... for the extra AB from Divine Wrath. I consider the +Wrath saves as just frosting in a semi-CHA CoT split, but nice if they can be had. The extra DS... meh. I usually only use 3 or 4 in a typical foray, so 6 is plenty IMO.

So, then it became a choice between Pal 8/DwD 12 or Pal 10/DwD 10. With about 400 HPs for a level 30 build, I feel that extra 3/- DR is more defensive and less significant with a high HP build and therefore opted for the more offensive route which is tough enough when dealing with a non-cleric DwD build.

Most likely, if this build were to progress into further levels, more DwD levels would make sense, but not with a 30-level cap. That's my reasoning, but your points are all well-acknowledged, Max.
